definitions.definition: to (cause something or someone to) move or change from one position or direction to another, especially slightly:
examples: She shifted (her weight) uneasily from one foot to the other.

definitions.definition: (of an idea, opinion, etc.) to change:
examples: Society's attitudes towards women have shifted enormously over the last century.

definitions.definition: to move the gears of a vehicle into different positions in order to make it go faster or slower:
examples: In cars that are automatics, you don't have to bother with shifting gears.

definitions.definition: to leave your home in order to live in a new one; move house
a group of workers who do a job for a period of time during the day or night, or the period of time itself:
examples: As the night shift leave/leaves, the day shift arrive/arrives.
